greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest proper divisor of the n-th composite number.
comment: Old name: The n-th positive composite number divided by its lowest nontrivial factor.
link: K. Stern, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9999
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = n + PrimePi@ n + 1}, While[k != n + PrimePi@ k + 1, k++ ]; k/FactorInteger[k][[1, 1]]]; Array[f, 75] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 11 2012 *)
program: function [a] = A160180(k) j = 0; n = 1; while j < k if isprime(n) == 1 skip elseif isprime(n) == 0 j = j + 1; factors = factor(n); lowfactor = factors(1,1); a(j,1) = n/lowfactor; end n = n + 1; end - _Kyle Stern_, May 04 2009
results.author: _Kyle Stern_, May 03 2009, May 04 2009
ext: Indices of b-file corrected, more terms added using b-file. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 31 2009
